definition: to have a face as terrifying as a temple's guardian deity (idiom)
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to gnash one's teeth in anger

sentences.english: And he laughs while he does it, he always added, scowling at his son.
sentences.chinese: 他總是加上這麼一句，並對他的兒子怒目相向。

sentences.english: Taylor looked daggers at Atticus, as if daring him to speak.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒法官對阿迪克斯怒目而視，似乎看他敢不敢說話。

sentences.english: She gave the rude man a glare.
sentences.chinese: 她對那個粗魯的男子怒目而視。

sentences.english: He sits alone all day scowling at passers-by.
sentences.chinese: 他整天獨自坐著，橫眉怒目地瞪著來往的人。

sentences.english: In disagreements, fight fairly. Please No name calling.
sentences.chinese: 意見相左時，不要怒目相向，也不要指名道姓爭吵。

sentences.english: The insects glared at me again.
sentences.chinese: 蟲子們再次對我怒目而視。

sentences.english: Now her anger was as hot as mine. We stood on equal ground.
sentences.chinese: 現在她和我一樣橫眉怒目，互不相讓。

sentences.english: The school Wei of other a few surplus towards Han Leng to glare at.
sentences.chinese: 其他幾個剩餘的校尉對着韓冷怒目而視。

sentences.english: The woman glared within the man after he shouted rudely at her.
sentences.chinese: 那男人野蠻地衝她大聲喊叫，她也怒目而視。

sentences.english: She handed out water to the protesting workers but got fierce stares.
sentences.chinese: 她把水分發給抗議的工人們，反倒遭到怒目相對。

sentences.english: Confused the angry ghost of her sister, as the back.
sentences.chinese: 糊塗鬼的姐姐回頭怒目相視。

sentences.english: The members of Club Med no longer need to glower across the table at each other.
sentences.chinese: 聯盟成員國不再需要像以前那樣在談判桌上怒目而視。

sentences.english: But all stood there, men and women, and glowered at him.
sentences.chinese: 但是人們都站在那裏，對他怒目而視。

sentences.english: He glared at me like a bull at a red rag.
sentences.chinese: 他像公牛怒視紅布一樣對我怒目而視。

sentences.english: The stonemasons were wroth with her, it seemed. The bricklayers as well.
sentences.chinese: 看起來石匠們也對她怒目相視，而磚匠們也一樣。

sentences.english: The teacher looked daggers at me, (with a) ruler in (his) hand.
sentences.chinese: 老師對我怒目而視，手裏拿著戒尺。

definition: to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
to scowl and stare down/to defy
to concentrate one's eyebrows/to frown/to scowl
from the side of the eye/askance
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
